job.title: Lead Data Scientist
job.description:
• We are a big Python shop. Ideally we like folks who worked in Python but will also talk to someone with R background.
  • Lead Data Scientist won’t manage a team; hands on individual contributor.
  • Comfort in environments where large projects are time-boxed and therefore consequential design decisions may need to be made and acted upon rapidly.
  • We like people who has experience with any of these areas: Deep Learning and its many incarnations (e.g., Adversarial Networks, Convolutional Networks, Recurrent / Recursive / Residual Nets), Natural Language Processing (NLP), image recognition, anomaly detection, speech recognition, time-series forecasting, geospatial modeling, Bayesian Networks or Bayesian inference more generally, Reinforcement Learning, Unsupervised techniques, or other data science and statistical tools and methods.
  • Candidates with fluency in the mathematical ‘primitives’ and generalizations of data science – e.g., expertise in Linear Algebra, and Vector Calculus usually do well.
  • Solid theoretical grounding in the mathematical core of the major ideas in data science
